instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message:
Don't waste time with U7100, if you get correct PPBUS_G3H.

Dp you get only two pulses, or power cycling every 5s?
VCORE and PLT_RESET_L pulsing at same time?
Any history fault available?
3V3_S5/SUS stable?

Inspect Q8150 and U1950 for corrosion.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message:
OK, HERE WE GO. 
Only 2 pulses when I connect the charger. Approx 5s between each pulse and then held at 23-24 mA. 
VCORE and PLT_RESET_L is pulsing at the same time. 
Q8150 and U1950 look super clean.
3v3_S5 / SUS are stable.
Something that I forgot to tell before. the trace between U3510 / 5 and c3510 was broken by corrosion. clean and made a jumper. 0.390V diode mode and 0.028V on that line.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100.
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message:
All SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces are good. I don't have another 820-00165 that I know of that works well. 
I extracted the bios and saved the original .bin. 
Can I do a Clear ME or something similar?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message: We already have some clean ME BIOSes posted for such board.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message: Sorry but I'm new here. Please can you tell me where I can find those files or send me a link for it? thanks for everything Master.

threads.message:

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message: thank you master. that doesn't work for me. What I could see is that PP5V_S0 is missing. What do you recommend? Thanks.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power. PP5V_S4RS3 (NO PRESENT)
threads.message:
Reball SMC, as basic step for boards where corrosion is noted.
If doesn't hekp, try heating CPU with quality flux; 10-15s, untill 180-200 degrees,
No need to melt the balls, just to burn eventually accumulated crap.
